title: Ronan Keating hints at Boyzone reunion tour to mark 25th anniversary – and makes us feel really old
text:
Ronan Keating (3rd L) says he’s been planing a Boyzone reunion to celebrate the band’s 25th anniversary with Mikey Graham (L), Keith Duffy (2nd L) and Shane Lynch (R) (Picture: Getty Images) Ronan Keating has revealed Boyzone’s 25th anniversary celebrations are in the works for 2018 – only we’ll just have to hang tight for the finer details. 
Now we know where Harry Styles has been hiding to record his first solo album Echoing his recent comments on Loose Women , the 40-year-old has floated a number of ideas to ‘mark’ the milestone, including a reunion tour and West End musical with remaining bandmates Keith Duffy, Mikey Graham and Shane Lynch – minus Stephen Gately who sadly died in 2009 .
‘Twenty five years! It’s such a long time and so much has happened,’ Keating told The Sun .
‘I’m sure we’ll mark it in some way. But whether by tour, record, book, musical. We haven’t decided yet.’
Boyzone members reformed briefly in 2008 for a world tour and to release a greatest hits album (Picture: Getty Images) A source close to the lads also confirmed to The Sun a Boyzone comeback was ‘well and truly on for 2018’.
‘It will be 25 years since they first started out so the lads want to do something extra special,’ they said.
‘Talks have been going on for a while and there are a number of ideas in the works.’
Boyzone scored six number one singles at the height of their fame in the 90s (Picture: Getty Images) Back in March 2016, former Westlife singer Brian McFadden teamed up with Boyzone’s Keith Duffy to form Boyzlife á la McBusted – with the lads performing greatest hits from the respective bands as a duo.
The source added: ‘Obviously Keith has been doing his thing in Boyzlife for the past year, which has been brilliant, but now all four of the boys are coming together.
‘It’s going to be a proper moment for pop music.’

Boyzone formed in 1993 and went to become one of the UK’s greatest boyband acts in the 90s, nailing six number one singles, 18 UK top 10 tracks, and selling 25million records across the globe.
Calling it a day in 2000, the band reunited for a 2008 world tour which was joined by a greatest hits album.

Original member Stephen Gately tragically died from a congenital heart defect at his Mallorca home in Spain the following year on October 10, 2009 .
At Gately’s funeral, the four remaining members of Boyzone stayed overnight in the church so Stephen wasn’t by himself as he was scared of the dark.
Metro.co.uk has reached out to Boyzone’s reps for further comment.
